page.title: 08Quarries
page.content: South of the{River Trent}in this area there have been{gravel quarries. A small amount is still obtained but most of it has now been extracted. It is still possible to see the piles of pinkish gravel as it comes from the ground and there are tall towers with conveyor belts taking the gravel away. However the countryside is not disfigured by this because when the quarries were worked out in the 1960's a very ambitious scheme was launched. The 270 acre site was used to build a {Watersports Centre}which was to be of Olympic standard. Now it provides a most important amenity for the area.
